questions.question: Question 1: Which of the following is not true about ventilation?

options.b: Involves quality control of outgoing air

questions.explanation:
Ventilation involves the quality control of incoming air but not quality control of outgoing air. It also involves the replacement of vitiated air(air with decreased oxygen content) by a supply of 
fresh outdoor air. It aims to provide a comfortable thermal environment and reduce the risk of 
infections.

questions.question: Question 2: What is the ideal number of air changes in a drawing-room?
questions.explanation: The number of air changes in drawing rooms or living rooms must be 2 – 3 per hour. The number of air changes in work rooms and assemblies must be 4 – 6 per hour.

questions.question: Question 3: What is ventilation provided by wind blowing through a space called?
questions.explanation:
Ventilation provided by wind blowing through a space is called perflation. Ventilation can be broadly classified as natural and mechanical: Natural ventilation includes: • Perflation is the ventilation of a space achieved by allowing wind to blow through it and 
removing the obstacles for this to happen (e.g., opening windows and doors). • Aspiration occurs when there is an obstruction as wind bypasses it and creates a suction action • Diffusion is the passage of air through small spaces or openings • Cross-ventilation is when air is allowed a natural path through the space by providing openings 
at appropriate places, opposite each other. The drawback of natural ventilation is that regulation of air quality is not possible. Mechanical ventilation includes: • Exhaust ventilation utilizes exhaust fans placed high up near the roof on the external walls. A 
vacuum is created by which fresh air enters the ventilated space. • Plenum ventilation uses centrifugal fans to blow fresh air into the room and create a positive 
pressure, by which vitiated air is pushed out. 586 
Sold by @itachibot • Balanced ventilation is the combination of both exhaust and plenum methods of ventilation. • Air conditioning can be done through mechanical ventilation. It is the simultaneous control of 
all or at least three factors that influence air quality in a confined room or space. These factors 
include temperature, humidity, air movement, distribution, dust, bacteria, odours and toxic gases.

questions.question: Question 6: Which of the following is not a social goal of housing standards?
questions.explanation: Prevention of non-infectious diseases is not a social goal of housing standards. The social goals of housing include: • Shelter • Family life • Access to community facilities • Family participation in community life • Economic stability

questions.question: Question 10: Which of the following is not a rural housing standard in India?

options.c: Built-up area should not exceed 1/3rd of total area
options.d: Window area should be 10% of floor area

questions.explanation: One room with sufficient space is not a rural housing standard in India. According to rural housing standards, there must be at least two living rooms. Rural housing standards are: • At least two living rooms • Ample verandah space • Separate kitchen with space for washing utensils • Built-up area should not exceed 1/3rd of total area • Sanitary latrine • Window area should be 10% of floor area • Sanitary well or tube well within quarter mile(400 m) of house • Cattle sheds must be 25 feet away from the house • Adequate arrangements for disposal of waste water, refuse and garbage

questions.question: Question 13: Which of the following is not an organization related to housing in India?
questions.explanation:
National Rural Housing Services is not an organization related to housing in India. Rural Housing Services is an agency of the ’nited States Department of Agriculture located in 
Washington, D.C. The organizations related to housing in India are: • National Buildings Organization (NBO). 593 
Sold by @itachibot • National Buildings Construction Corporation Ltd. • Housing and ’rban Development Corporation (H’DCO). • Hindustan Housing Factory. They work under the ’nion Ministry of works and Housing to deal with various aspects of 
housing.
